text: Ian Robert Callaghan (born 10 April 1942) is a retired English footballer. He played between 1959 and 1982 as a midfielder. He is best known as a Liverpool player. He holds the record for most times played for Liverpool, at 857 appearances. He won 17 honours with Liverpool, including two European Cups, in 1977 and 1978. He also played four times for the England national football team. Callaghan was born in Toxteth, Liverpool. == Career statistics == Appearances and goals by club, season and competition Club Season League FA Cup League Cup Continental Total Division Apps Goals Apps
